Univariate Gaussian Distribution is Normalized

Premmi

To prove that the univariate Gaussian distribution is normalized, we will first show that it is normalized for a zero-mean Gaussian and extend that result to show that N(x∣µ, σ2) is normalized.

The pdf of the zero-mean Gaussian distribution is given by:
     
ϕ(x)= 
1
√
2πσ2

To integrate this expression we make the transformation from Cartesian coordinates (x, y) to polar coordinates (r, θ), which is defined by

     
x = r   cos θ             (5)
y = r   sin  θ              (6)

and using the trigonometric identity cos2 θ + sin2  θ = 1, we have x2 + y2 = r2. Also the Jacobian of the change of variables is given by,
